Notable Projects

A collection of some of the personal and proffessional projects that I'm most proud of (and allowed to share).

HTML CSS JS Java MySQL PHP
Designer
Developer
Professional/Academic

eNuk

The eNuk Program is an integrated environment and health mobile application designed with and for the Inuit of Rigolet, Nunatsiavut to streamline and incorporate the community’s existing research efforts into a comprehensive tech strategy for monitoring climatic changes. The Android app is currently in beta-testing and the iOS app is set to be released in late 2019. While I cannot share the code, you can check-out the following High-Fidelity App Prototype.

See More

Shell Python Ansible
Developer
Project Lead
Professional/Academic

Rigolet Data-Comms Assessment Program

I worked on this project as a Mitacs intern on the Rightmesh Project, as well as a MSc thesis to support local monitoring systems in Rigolet. I built and loaded custom network monitors to log the internet around town, and modeled the affects of external variables on transfer speeds. While I can't share this research, you can explore the Pi Code, RightMesh Project or a sample visualization of the data speeds in my house.

See More

YAML CSS JS
Designer
Developer
Personal - Development

Lawrence Assistant

I often get gifted various tech and 'Smart Home' devices, but I quickly got fed-up with the growing list of settings, apps, crappy API's and closed ecosystems which made connecting the devices nearly impossible. Lawrence Assistant is a custom built SmartHome system running on a Hass.io backend. This project has gotten a surpising amount of attention within the Home Assistant Forums and on Reddit.

See More
